titles.title: Parental Title Protection Act of 2011
To require that all Federal agencies, contractors, and government-sponsored enterprises use the words "mother" and "father" when describing parents in all official documents and forms.

bill.summary: 2/10/2011--Introduced. Parental Title Protection Act of 2011 - Requires federal agencies, contractors, or government-sponsored enterprises to use the words "mother" and "father" when describing parents, and not the words "parent 1" or "parent 2" (or similar words), in all official documents issued by such entities.
